description: Rear-drive sedan of class E (factory index G30). Restyling of the seventh generation of the model. The presentation of the model took place on May 27 in an online format.
overview: After the modernization, the 5 Series sedan retained its recognizability, changing in details. The now narrower head optics received L-shaped DRLs, the proprietary elements of the false radiator grille are now made in a single unit, and the front bumper (in the basic version and Luxury Line) has a smile of the air intake with vertical sections on the sides. The car's profile has not undergone changes, but the stern received lamps with a modified pattern, a redrawn bumper, as well as trapezoidal exhaust pipes already in the base. 17-inch rims are standard, as are all-diode optics. Changes in the interior of the sedan are much less than in the exterior. Of the most notable - the modernized design of the graphics of the virtual dashboard, as well as the diagonal of the multimedia touch display increased to 12.3 inches (the basic versions are equipped with a 10.25-inch one). The latter is now running a seventh generation operating system for increased responsiveness; remote software updates are also now available. Earlier, a wireless connection with a phone was only available for Apple CarPlay, after restyling, Android Auto was also connected (moreover, data from the smartphone is also displayed on the head-up display). The changed buttons on the steering wheel are less visible.

specifications.name: Engine capacity(l):
specifications.hint: Engine capacity refers to the volume swept by all the pistons of an engine, within their bores, from the top to the bottom of their travel.

specifications.name: Horse power(hp):
specifications.hint: Horsepower (hp) is a unit of measurement of power, or the rate at which work is done, usually in reference to the output of engines or motors.

specifications.name: Torque(Nm):
specifications.hint: Torque is a twisting force that speaks to the engine's rotational force and measures how much of that twisting force is available when an engine exerts itself.
